result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul J. Ruiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with A.D.S. dob 12/8/2000.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed.
Defendant shall be in compliance with sex offender registration.
Defendant shall be in compliance with AfterCare recommendations.

Court orders:  Prison 11 years with 4 years initial confinement followed by 7 years extended supervision
Conditions of extended supervision:

Supervision fees
Submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate and abide by treatment recommendations

Be in compliance with sex offender registration
Be in compliance with any AfterCare recommendations
